page.title: 14Cadets at the T.A. Centre
page.content: Cadets arrive at the Centre at 7pm. They fall in, do drill, have a NAAFI, take part in various activities and are dismissed at 9.30pm. New recruits practise shooting in the rifle range using air rifles. They can also go running and do map-and-compass practice. On Tuesday nights there is a first aid course and Thursday night is band practice. Cadets also go on a week-end camp. During the year they take part in public events such as the Suffolk Show and Bury St. Edmunds Carnival. On August 4th 1985 they are doing a pageant for Domesday. Later they leave for a fortnight's camp at Folkestone where they will go out on battlefields and take part in activities such as parascending, canoeing and watermanship drill.
